DOC.brief_summary: Specific Aims : 1 . The primary aim study conduct formative interview teen mother inform target adaptation empirically base weight management parent training program teen mother preschooler . 2 . To conduct small pilot post-pilot focus group feasibility acceptability recruitment retention method & intervention . Study Hypotheses : Given small sample size fact pilot study , focus estimate effect size rather statistical hypothesis testing . However , investigator exploratory hypothesis follow : 1 . ( ) The adapt intervention feasible compare wellness control condition , participant retention rate ≥80 % average adherence ( attendance weekly treatment session ; homework completion 5 weekday weekly ) ≥ 75 % ; ( b ) The adapt intervention acceptable compare wellness control condition , base Consumer Satisfaction Scale Therapy Assessment Inventory ≥90 % participant respond item , `` In general satisfied intervention ? '' choose `` unsatisfied '' `` satisfy . '' 2 . ( ) The adapt intervention result great improvement child behavior parent-child connectedness compare control condition ; ( b ) adapt intervention versus wellness control condition result great increase child teen mother individual well joint physical activity physically active play great reduction individual joint teen mother child sedentary behavior ( television view ) baseline post-intervention ; ( c ) great teen mother child fruit vegetable consumption ; reduce child juice sugar-sweetened beverage consumption baseline post-intervention ; ( ) adapt intervention versus wellness control condition result small increase child BMI percentile teen mother BMI baseline post-intervention ; ( e ) participant attend high number intervention session show great improvement target outcome ( child behavior , parent-child connectedness , teen mother child physical activity , sedentary behavior BMI ) ; participant receive adapt intervention versus wellness control show great dose-based improvement .
DOC.brief_title: Project HERA ( Health , Education , Relationship-building Adolescents- Moms Tots )
